description:
Solid, classic American burger.
For $7.50/6oz. burger including cheese, the quality of the burger and the service was excellent. We got three burgers, all medium rare, one on a whole wheat bun, one with American cheese, and two with cheddar cheese, and some fries. Each burger came with lettuce, tomato, some pickles, and their house sauce. The fries were Crispy Crunchy, on the outside, warm and soft on the inside, and salted nicely.  The sauce on the burger added some nice flavor to the perfectly cooked meat and cheese.  
This spot was an unexpected treat near Union Square with friendly service from the cashier, who is also the guy who cooked the burgers.
I will definitely be coming back here.
author: Andrew D.

description:
It says on the menu Make it a combo for $3.00 So I ordered and come to find out it's not all true..so the Garlic fries are not included with this deal. And it doesn't say it anywhere it's not included.
And we ordered 2 burger's and drinks and fries and a strawberry fiesta crepe.
And the crepe comes 1st.
Not good BURGERHOUSE
author: Brad B.

description:
Burger House was another place that... I have walked by for so many times in the San Francisco Downtown Area!!! Until yesterday on my lunch time break from work and decided that i wanted to go to the Burger House and wanted to buy myself some Onion Rings which wasn't that bad at all!!!

The Onion Rings that... I bought from the Burger House which was my very 1st Time ever!!! The Onion Rings was very hot and crispy which tasted very good!!! If your in the Downtown San Francisco Area for a visit from out of town and if you like eating Onion Rings like me... My tip to you Yelpers go to the Burger House!!!
author: William B.

description: The food was pretty on point. The garlic fries was really good, really filling as well! Free refills are always a plus. The customer service was really great! He was really friendly, funny and welcoming! I told him we was from NY because we were kind of loud and he was understanding lol. Nice chill spot!
author: Yashar R.

description: They sell tacos here too, which were pretty good. They cut the meat and cook it fresh when you order. The lady gets the masa and makes the tortillas right there. Spicy salsas were great!
author: Sara M.

description: Came here while visiting San Francisco for the weekend.  The burger here was excellent and the fries were also great!  Reasonably priced for the area and service was good.
author: Alaina S.

description:
Overall this place wasn't terrible, but it wasn't amazing. just kinda.. eh. 
I ordered the grilled chicken burger. The chicken was plain, but they add cheese and toppings as well. Overall it was pretty flat to me, no fireworks in my mouth. 
The fries though are awesome!!!! They are crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Yummy fries!! Definitely get the fries.
It's a small place, probably only seats 8 people. And the service time was at a reasonable, cant complain.
author: Jessica B.

description: Juiciest burger ever. We make it a point to come here have a burger and share a crepe. It's so good. Fresh burgers, fresh cut fries and yummy crepes. Plus pizza is next door. WHAAAAT!!!! The burger is juicy, cooked well and served HOT! There was not 1 unhappy person and full and satisfied. Fries served hot too. Nothing fancy with buns and burgers, just food what you expect a burger to be. They offer hot dogs, sweet potato fries and onion rings. The crepes are so good too. But I've never had one from anywhere but here so I don't know a good from bad one. But these crepes with strawberry and Nutella as made fresh and so yummy.
author: Jeanette T.

description:
Running around the streets of San Francisco, I found myself REALLY starving. I'm a foodie, and though I really enjoy trying new flavors, cuisines, etc., I really just wanted to have some something simple. 

If that's where you are today, look no further. This place is truly special, and I just happened to stumble upon it. 

Seeing as though I was really hungry, I didn't much look at the rest of the menu and ordered the double cheeseburger as a combo. It's a small place with limited seating (bar style seating), so I just hung out and watched the gentleman cook my burger. Unfortunately I didn't catch his name, but if he's reading this, thank you! 

My burger was PERFECT. Cooked just barely well done, the meat was fresh, juicy, and full of flavor (simple seasoning of salt and pepper). The veggies on top were fresh and didn't get in the way of the beef's flavor. Fries were cooked perfectly too.

If you're looking for a quick bite that is delicious, not too crowded, and easy on the wallet, this burger is for you!
author: David V.

description: Really solid good hamburger, tasty and juicy burger with bacon and avocado. Fries are really nice with crispy feeling. If yue are by the center this is a good option for hungry ones!
author: David S.

description: It's a perfect place to come if you wanna grab something quick. Their burger is good and fries are fresh!
author: Kim P.

description: Crepes were just not good.  We actually could not even cut them with the plastic utensil and ended up tossing most of it in the trash.
author: Pat F.

description:
The burger itself is fine.  I got the double. This is almost as good as a 5 Guys cut of meat.  The fries are terrible.   If you need a decent burger and are in no rush and in downtown SF this place is OK.

But the service sucks.  The service is 0/5 stars.  If I ran this place I would lay everyone off immediately.  They don't care.  I ordered, I wasn't asked what toppings I wanted, then they spent five minutes looking at the receipt paper for some reason.  One other customer was in the store and already had their food.  5 minutes after that, they put the burger in the grill. This is a prime location at 630 on a Friday and the place is almost empty.   Ownership needs to act on this or they are just throwing money away.
author: Jamie S.

description: Nice and friendly staff. Delicious and fresh food. Healthy juice. It's not fancy but they do have grass fed meat.
author: Hani G.

description: Pretty much the worst (most dry) crepe I've ever had. Not many other options in the area I understand, but if the mall is open, go there instead. Any sweets/desserts you find down there will be better this place. FYI-did not try the burgers or fries, though they looked good.
author: Eliza F.

description: Burger house is a convenient place to eat late at night. The staff is really friendly. Quality of the food could be better but for the cheap price, there isn't much to complain about. The burger patties are bland and the buns are extremely dry. They are very generous with their servings though.
author: Vladimir M.

description:
These guys have a good burger when your looking for a place that is open late!
I ordered the double burger with fries.
author: Shawn M.

description:
Duuuude - Ok, to set the tone, I will qualify the low score.  It's the darn SERVICE!!  The only reasons I gave it 2 stars:  

1) the pizza place attached to the burger place was enthusiastic and 'ready' to provide attentive service.  (#potential)

2) the cook had to find a clerk to get my order started

3) the clerk was in a corner LOOKING AT ME while he dried dishes.  Let me clarify, he was only drying  one dish (a tiny bowl).  (#hellaWeird #dishesCanWait #howDryDoesThatBowlHaveToBe)

4) with limited seating, an employee was sitting in the back of the restaurant - taking up three seats - doing ...  taxes? or doodling? or creating a vision board?  Sometimes, it pays to have a smidgen of situational awareness..  (#dontMakePatronsStand)

This is not a minor rant, I can withstand substandard service, but this was egregious.  Management can find better resources to run this place.  If I had the time, and the patience for sweet sweet revenge - I'd open a burger spot right next door with awesome service ... just to put them outta business.  But that is so petty and not worth my time.  So, this yelp post is the alternative.  

If you are hungry, just keep on walking - you'll find something better.
author: Kendall B.

description: The service is really terrible. The people who work here are very rude. One waitress talked on her phone right next to where we were trying to eat our "breakfast". And I put that word in quotes because the food we ordered was barely edible. Now we know why it was the only place without a line.
author: Julia D.

description: Can you explain this BS, it looks like a vibranium chorizo, WTF. Get people who actually know how to do Mexican food.
author: Douglas V.

description: Waited 30 minutes for 2 crepes. I'm supposed to write more for this to be a review instead of a tip. But all I have to say that it took a really long time for some crepes.
author: Ben M.

description: Probably about the worst service you can get. Been there two times before didn't get to order cause no one walked up to the register to take my order. Third time i asked how long it took to make a burger cause i had to catch a bart in 20 min, the guy said 10 minutes. I said okay i should have enough time and ordered. He waited 10 minutes to put my burger on the grill when the restaurant was empty. I wasn't sure what he was so angry about that would motivate him to deliberately do something so rude and disrespectful to a complete stranger. I never got to try the burger, they had no intention of getting it to me before i had to leave. The owner should sell this business, it could easily be turned around into something that brings in lots of cash if they hire a few employees that are willing to take customers orders as they arrive.
author: Joseph K.

description:
Ok so I walked in expecting to pay $6.50 which is actually what drew me in and decide to eat here but instead paid $11.15 total after added cheese and $3.00 combo add on. I got the 4oz which I kind of regretted because I can barely taste the meat. Eh not thrilled but wasn't exactly expecting a fast cheap quick meal by this area. 

The fries were on the less than average side but I guess cuz it's "virgin" it makes up for it. 

Great for a quick meal. The food was average. The burger was pretty good for a small patty. 

I scored an outlet by the back. I came by lunch time and surprisingly no line. A small crowd. 

I did like how they had condiments available-especially the jalapeños and pickles! I was pretty happy about that cuz not many burger joints do that. Some charge extra. 

The works were pretty attentive )for an establishment of this type) and always moving. 

I like the layout. I feel like I'm in the 50's lol. They pretty much have high bar tops where you can see all the action of the workers cooking/preparing food but there's also outside seating. 

Oh & I heard there's a groupon out! Just seen a lady use one. Dang it. I needa get on that. 

I would come again for something chill, convenient easy & overall good.
author: Jill H.

description: I was gonna say 4 stars, but then I read some other reviews and had to agree with 3 stars. I had a single burger with no frills. It was about $8 with tax. It was not satisfying at all. The patty was very thin..the roll was not toasted and overwhelmed the patty. $8 was just too expensive for a simple burger. It should be like $4.
author: Denise C.

description: Veggie crepe is really good! Burgers are juicy and tasty. I could have passed on the strawberry shake; it was just ok.
author: Paula M.

description: Burger is alright. The service is horrible. Don't go here for ok food. It's not going to satisfy your hunger.
author: Mark V.

description:
Average sums this place up nicely.  The double burger was not over-cooked, in fact there was a bit of pink in the center which is fine by me.  Yet somehow, by the time I finished it was dry.  Good bun, fresh lettuce and ripe tomato slice.  Ohion rings were mostly batter.

For the price, in this location, no complaints.
author: Lxs S.

description:
Best Nutella crepes in town. Period.

Burgers are great too, and cheap. There's also tables and chairs outside so if it's sunny you can enjoy Powell street and say hi to the people riding the cable car.
author: Eduardo M.

description:
This place is a step above fast food burgers, at OK prices, given the neighborhood and alternative options in the area.  I had a double burger on a Thursday night.  Service was OK, food was OK, value was OK, taste was meh.  

The meat didn't taste very fresh/quality, and lacked much beer flavor.  My patties weren't overcooked, there was a good amount of seasoning/salt, but there's yet some dryness and lack of taste.  If you want to do a burger in the area, try Burger Bar on top of Macy's - at least their burgers there are juicy.
author: Leo C.

description:
This is right next door (shares the same kitchen) with Powell street pizza, who just received a poor health inspection, FYI.  The both have groupons running and we mistakenly thought they were different places.  
Both the hot dog and hamburger and fries were undercooked and the garlic fries were awful.
author: Robin D.

description: Stopped here for a late night crepe. It was made fresh and we were able to watch them prepare them. I'm not sure if i was disappointed in the crepe itself, or the menu options. There were only about 3 or 4 to choose from, 2 of which were very plain. I had the nutella and strawberry and was just not impressed by it, and I normally love crepes. There was way too much nutella and hardly any strawberries. I wouldn't come back.
author: Kelsey H.

description: Solid 4/5 stars.  Great options for crepes.  Made fresh while you wait.  We opted for the ham and cheese add bacon and add egg for breakfast before we headed to the airport.  Was satisfied with our choice and it was big enough to share.  I would recommend our option but next time I will try something new. Orange juice tastes exactly like a refreshing orange.  Hit the spot!  Great location fast service good grub.  Give it a try.
author: Corine M.

description: We had a living social voucher that we paid $15 for to get $25 worth of food. We ordered one cheeseburger combo, one cheeseburger and one slice of veggie pizza. That had us owing them about $2. We ate the cheeseburgers and fries there and took the pizza to go. The cheeseburgers were good but I would not say outstanding. The buns could have been toasted or at least warmed. But they were what I'd call pretty good. The fries were about the same - pretty good. We took the pizza back to our hotel to put in the fridge and have for breakfast. It was also pretty good, especially for cold pizza! So all in all, it was a good deal. Don't expect much in the way of ambiance though. It's basically just a hole in the wall with the bare minimum to fill the requirement of a place to sit while eating, about 6 tables maybe. We were there around 8 pm and it was a little busy but we were able to grab a table to sit and eat.
author: Susan C.

description:
Id say this is an ok burger place. I had the super burger (added on mushrooms and onion rings). I enjoyed it! It was a big burger, and very juicy. The garlic fries were ok. Had plenty of garlic taste, but no different than anywhere else that serves garlic fries.
I think it would have been cheaper to get the combo, though
author: Melissa S.

description: It's about $11 for an 8 oz burger, which actually tastes pretty good. Got here with only two guys in front of us, but still somehow took a little over 10 minutes to start my burger. Staff was courteous, though.
author: Robert U.

description:
Went on a Sunday for lunch, came in the pizza place that is attached to it but the burger side smelled so good that I had to get it!

Not a very service oriented place but the burgers are great! Taste pretty good and simply done, not much exaggeration on ingredients. The fries are really good as well!

Good place if you are alone and want to grab something fast but not a good place to go as a group of friends.
author: AJ F.

description:
The worst place I had a burger and fries. First, the staff were rude and unemotional. It is like they do not care but it is to be expected when someone is paid a low wage. I saw cross contamination with the server/cook not washing his hands between handling the meat patties and the fries and other stuff. The burger and fries were just above acceptable. There was no taste and the fries were soggy. The tourists seem to like their crepes.

Also, be careful about your belongings. There are multiple access doors to other dining places next door. I had my backpack stolen here and there is no cameras or other security there. Someone can steal it pickpocket you and they can get away easy.  To San Franciscan residents, do yourself a favor and let the tourists go here. There are better burger places like Popson's and Super Duper.
author: Paul V.

description: Hamburger was bland. Add-ons where overpriced. The lady working the register didn't pay attention and never got my order in. I stood around waiting while 3-4 people after me got their orders. I asked her if mine was still on the way. Without saying anything to me, she passed my ticket to the cook and went back to chatting with her friend. No apology or acknowledgment of her screw up. Very unprofessional and careless.
author: Fernando D.

description: Chef did not wash hands! Disgusting! Witnessed him come out of kitchen take out trash move chairs around and continue touching food without washing hands. Dirty place!!!!!! Avoid!!!!
author: Tom A.

description: Pretty awful, the burger wasn´t that terrible, unlike the fries, but it seems like the sanitary inspector somehow skip this place
author: Fede R.

description: Burger was good and so were the fries. But even in a busy place like this, at least someone could've yelled out..."hi, thanks for waiting. We'll be right with you!".Instead, the entire staff walked right past ignoring me for at least 10 minutes. Was so hungry I stayed. Felt like a bother to the cook who shouldn't have had to stop and take my order. On the other hand, in the same place, the pizza guy was super friendly to my husband. Hubby got to eat before me and watch me power down the burger when it finally came. Walk around Union Square and find another burger place.
author: K O.

description: This place was ok. It was decent. The Service is decent, the food is decent enough. A tad over priced. The Burger bun was inconsistent in texture, the middle was tough while the surrounding area was soft like bread should be. The Burger patty itself was decent, cooked all the way through, a tad bland. The milkshake....it was really a MILKshake, I had ordered a Vanilla Milkshake, didn't take too long to make. It was blended so long and had so much milk put into it that it felt like I was drinking a slightly thicker milk with a hint of Vanilla.
author: Ethan P.

description: The bad reviews on service are true. No acknowledgement from staff and they pretty much have no personality. On a Tuesday night at 9pm, it was pretty busy, but the establishment didn't seem to care. Came in here with two others since we saw them making crepes from the windows. Ordered the strawberry fields crepe and the pesto crepe. Both were ok. Strawberry crepe (I also added bananas) had like 3 thin slices of strawberries and so much Nutella. I couldn't handle more than 3 bites. Had some of the pesto chicken Crepe that my friend got, it was ok. Overall, I think the crepe batter is good and the portions were large, but it is pricey for what it was. Being that it was just ok, I wouldn't quite rule it out. However, being that the service was nonexistent, I actually wouldn't want to bring my business here again.
author: Monica S.

description: Dirty, noisy, took 30 minutes for my poor burger to get to me. Extremely busy and disorganized. Burger was ok, a little burnt
author: Eyal R.

description: Hot dog, fries and a soda for less than $10.  Good service too.  And they serve beer.  Great for a quick bite without paying through the nose.
author: Al B.

description:
This is the worst place I have ever been. Not because of the food. But the service was awful, which says a lot because you order from the cashier and seat yourself. The cashier is the first and last person you have contact with. 

I went in and saw they offered a cheeseburger, so I asked the cashier if I could have that but without a patty. The cashier gives me an unpleasant look and says "no."
 "I said I don't mind paying for a cheeseburger I just don't want the meat," and she again tells me "no." I asked if there was any way she could try to accommodate me and she said "you can order something on the menu."

I was craving a grilled cheese. It seems so simple. It's bread and cheese I didn't even want anything fancy or extra cheese.
author: Mallory C.

description:
Typical standard burger.  I left unimpressed, but satisfied.

It is definitely not a "Burger House" when this place has no selections on burgers.  They only offer a super burger or a junior burger, which is still the same style of burger, but one is made bigger than the other.

They offer jalapenos and pickles on the sides.  Two of my favorites with burgers!  They also, of course, have ketchup and mustard. 

The layout of this place is chill.

Final say - Skip this place.  There are other better burger places around this area.
author: Tiffany D.

description: I decided to get a turkey burger from this place because I check on here and they said it was amazing so I gave it a try. My burger was red and My fries were cold. I tried to tell them and they said it wasn't. The service wasn't so great and the lady was disrespectful to mostly everyone that came in. I do not recommend this place at all.  The only reason I'm giving it a star is because I have to in order to give a feed back.
author: Melanie S.

description:
This place was 10/10. At midnight, the place was decently busy. The staff was friendly and helpful. The food came out pretty quick. My wife got Citrus Smoothie and she loved it. It had a sweet orange tang. We also ordered Sweet Potato Fries that were delicious! Lastly, we ordered the Classic Crepe and it didn't disappoint. It would have been better if we added a fruit but the actual base (the pancake) was tasty and very thin! The classic reminded us of French toast since its partnered with Maple syrup.

The only down side is there is limited seating available.

Would recommend!
author: Kevin And Daniela H.

description: Awesome chicken pesto crepes and steak burger! Thumbs Up! Must Try in SFO! Affordable price too!
author: Angelina A.

description: Just ordered a grass fed burger can't wait to try it I was gladly served by pinky who took my order what courteous waiter if recommended this place to 1st time San franciscans tourists the restaurant is clean classic looking a choice of  and burgers  and a reasonable wait time and good pricing
author: Jerome S.

description:
I went twice to that place, the guy wasn't nice at all.
The burger is fine not more then 2 stars. 
The problem is that after I ate there I had an upset stomach.
I think they put me something in the food because I had an argument with the guy that you pay for because he wasn't nice and willing to help.
author: Francesco G.

description: It was good, the fries where awesome. The burger was ok it needs a better sauce. For example a home made sauce, not just 1000 island. Also the black bean burger is yummy but it DEFINITELY needed some sort of sauce. So I guess the point that of the story here is sauce they need sauce.
author: Chris K.

description: They have a selection of fresh juices that they make as soon as you order them, for about $8 a cup. The crepes are good, also had a chicken burger which was ok. For fast food this place is convenient.
author: Bruno N Brisa's Mom W.

description: The burger was just OK, not impressed. Of course, it is convenient to eat Burgers If you don't have enough time for your dinner. The owner was nice, and we talked several words when I wait for my burger.
author: Mark C.

description:
Nothing makes you smell like a tourist than eating on Powell Street. After all, what kind of idiotic local would find himself looking for a place to eat on that strip of commercial excess and moral depravity? I guess that would be me. Y'see, I was finding myself strolling down Nob Hill thinking I really wanted a bite and landed in the Burger House since it was relatively quiet on a Thursday evening. Now I've been to Hubert Keller's Burger Bar in Macy's, so I figured I needed to try what the peasants eat at street level. I'm a people-person after all.

It's an odd set-up where they have the world's skinniest counter in front of the grill and prep area, and the place is saddled adjacent to a Cafe Bellini and a pizza place. Yes, it's a suburban mall court next to Union Square to appease the tourists. There was a free stool, so I parked myself after ordering the $6.25 double-patty Super Burger with all the free toppings and of course, the $2 Virgin Fries (see photos). The size of the burger was certainly right, and the lettuce, red onion, tomato, jalapenos, and secret sauce were all in there and accounted for. By the way, is the secret sauce a tribute to Jack-in-the-Box?

Yet for all that effort, something tasted a bit off for me, and I have to say the texture of the meat was a bit too mealy for my taste. The fries, however, I really liked because they were thick-cut (...no jokes please) with the skin left on and a bit on the wilty-greasy side which I prefer when they're that big. They give you quite a hefty portion here, and I couldn't finish it which is rare for me as you know. So the next time I want to feel like I want to replicate a shopping mall experience without having to schlep to Tanforan or Serramonte, then I have an option that isn't outside my Clipper Card zone.

FOOD - 3 stars...big but average-tasting burger with stand-out fries
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...compact space and oh-so mallish
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...nice guy manages the place
TOTAL - 3 stars...if Hubert is not part of your Google+ circle, well...
author: Ed U.

description: Had dinner on 12/17, before seeing a play at the A.C.T. The burgers were tasting and juicy. I would definitely go back.
author: John S.

description: Came to Burger House during a visit to SF. It is located on Powell St near Union Square and Powell BART station. I had high hopes for this place since it's in a busy food area. However I was disappointed.  I ordered their burger combo which included fries and a drink. The burger was made to order, but the flavor just wasn't there. The bun wasn't even warm. I expected more from a made to order burger place. The fries were also standard, nothing special. I wouldn't come here unless you just want a regular burger, then you'd get exactly that.
author: Joe G.

description:
My date and I came here after a night of shopping in lively Union Square. 

This place is also connected with a pizza place and a camera store. Sounds familiar?

She was hungry and had the smoked apple sausage. For $6.25, the grilled apple sausage had grilled onions in a toasted bun. Fries are also included with the dog. The fries are tasty though. My date enjoyed the hot dog, despite not in the same league as Berkeley's Top Dog. Hot dog: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/r8hUFsWdilGbpcEnchmyqA?select=KWrd3UW3d5ZF1durAXohNg

I had dinner prior to our meeting. So I had a Black and White milkshake. For $4.50, the thick milkshake is a mixture of milk, Chocolate and Vanilla ice cream in a chocolate swirled glass. This is not an exciting milk shake. As a milkshake-lover, I do enjoy the drink. Milkshake: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/r8hUFsWdilGbpcEnchmyqA?select=zdT1i-rDjNSd1Zc7Wo67hQ

As we were enjoying our treat, other people were enjoying the burgers. The burgers look really good and attractive. I may try that on my/our return. 

For a burger joint in the touristy part of town, the food wasn't bad. I may need to come back and check out the burgers.
author: Matt G.

description:
I had the tastiest and greenest burger ever. Put $1.5 extra for avocado added in and guarantee you would 't be disappointed.
Try the fresh juice here since you could see their
Fresh cut apple and orange in the fridge
author: Na L.

description:
I would give this place a 3.5. It's good and quick. I ordered the spicy black bean burger. It had good flavor but was not at all spicy and although their buns are a nice thought, there is a bit too much bread and the way they toast it makes it a bit more stale than toasted. 

There were five of us and we all ordered something different. The sliders had good flavor but the small patty was lost on the bun. 

The chicken burger, or rather the chicken sandwich, was good. The ham and cheese crepe was good as well. 

Nothing horrible nothing great about the food. Just good. 

Service was quick and friendly.
author: Carissa W.

description: Pretty delicious as far as burger joint go, with really awesome fries and a great burger, albeit on a stale bun.  I was staying nearby at the Orange Village Hostel and I was happy to find this place instead of getting stuck at Jack in the Box (which I will forever equate with killing small children with their e coli infested burgers).
author: Patti M.

description: Hindu manager is rude ! Argues and will deny what he says ! Very rude and disrespectful
author: Maninder G.

description: This restaurant was directly across from our hotel.  After a day of touring and a short nap, we wandered across the street for supper.  Seating is very limited as it was too chilly to sit outside.  We were able to get seats at the counter.  Our server and cook was very friendly and fun to talk with. The burgers and fries were delicious.  They are fresh made as you watch.  After dinner we walked around for an hour or so and listened to street musicians on the corner then came back to The Burger House for dessert.  We had a Nutella, banana and strawberry crepe.  Absolutely wonderful.  A great way to end a busy day.
author: Mary T.

description: Agreed, quick tasty burger while in a hurry in the city.  Outstanding garlic fries!  I was actually really impressed with this place, I had given up finding anything good, and hunger took over.  But the service was actually top notch, they had Niman Ranch beef, and the guy behind the counter was actually really friendly and we chatted about the restaurant.  He seemed to truly enjoy what he did, and in the end, made my meal into a pleasant evening.  Recommend for basic, quick and easy food.
author: Kaitlyn M.

description: Not even sure how the food is because j went to try this place and the lady behind the counter was too busy clipping her nails to notice me there. I refuse to eat somewhere where someone thinks it's ok to cut her nails at work behind a counter where food is made.
author: Zachary B.

description: They are a bit slow taking your order and getting it to the cook, but other than that, for just a burger joint, this place has really good food.  A word of warning, the burgers are really messy, so ask for extra napkins.
author: Paul G.

description:
The fries here were amazing. The star does not represent the food, it represents the disrespect I witnessed happening towards my friend. 
Two employees working the kitchen were staring and talking about my friend in Spanish, right in front of us behind the counter. My friend is going through changes, and the two of them were staring/glancing at her in inappropriate ways and areas. 
I took a photo of their backs, just so they can have a taste of what it feels like to be publicly humiliated. 
This is SF, guys. Get educated in these areas, quit spreading toxic energy, and be an ally to others.
author: Rose M.

description: I forget what the hot dog I had was called, but it had onion, avocado, tomatoes, arugula, and some white sauce on it. It was SO good! I had it 2 days in a row during my weekend visit. I would definitely recommend trying it! (Also, if anyone knows what that sauce is, let me know so I can make this for myself at home here in San Diego)!
author: Shiloh O.

description: When u in a rush good burger place at a good location... didn't have the fries but I did have the junior burger which was a good size and was pretty good
author: Raymond W.

description:
This place has really good  gourmet burgers.
The onion rings and fries are delicious.
Burger House is one of the few places in this neighborhood that stays open LATE.
Yum!
author: Charles S.

description:
The food here is pretty good.  The sesame bun is kind of crappy though, seems kind of stale/hard.  The meat is pretty good and you can get it with toppings like fried egg, bacon, blue cheese etc.   

The fries are super hard/crunchy and not in a good way.   

Update: apparently only our batch of fries were super hard/crunchy.   My friend's fries were normal and similar to In n out.  

There are some bar seating inside and a few small tables outside.
author: Ben Y.

description:
I know it's called 'burgerhouse' but i think it's the crepes you gotta go in for. Theyre actually really good! And value for money too. Big size and the inside of the crepe is packed. I had the chicken pesto crepe which was a great chopped chicken-spinach-mozzarella-tomato-pesto dish that was simple and straightforward. I dont normally like pesto outside of home but this one was just right! Comes with a side of leafy greens too as a salad. Loved how the crepe itself was sooo yummy. Thickness and softness were just right; great subtly sweet flavor. I can already imagine how it would taste with one of the dessert crepes they have on the menu too, mmm. 
My stars are just for the food though, the place isn't exactly the cleanest, and beware of aggressive homeless dudes that randomly storm in the place and harass everyone (*sadface* comes with the location i guess so whatevs), but for tired tourists looking for a quick, cheap, delicious, filling bite around the union square area, you can definitely try here.
author: Maggie N.

description: Absolutely delicious. I ordered the Black Bean Burger because I'm vegan and it was amazing. The "meat" was incredible and paired wonderfully with the alfalfa sprouts and cucumber (never thought I would like cucumber on a burger!). I also added some sweet relish. Service was great and food was even better. Plus, prices are so reasonable! Definitely recommend.
author: Zak C.

description: The family and i where fixing for a good crepes and the only thing we got.... good crepes. Customer service does not exist in this establishment. We waited in front of the cash register for more then 10 minutes waiting for the employees conversation  to finish about how unfair working the afternoon shift was. Blah blah blah!! The only reason I gave them 3 stars is because the food was exceptionally good! Keep up the great work guys!
author: Nef A.

description: Burgers are amazing. They cook each burger right in front of you so you know it's fresh! Love this little spot, for reasonable prices as well. Three hard working, fast paced men were working when I was there. Great job guys!
author: Priscilla S.

description: Great burger. Plain and simple.  Nice staff. And great fries.  Oh. And it's cheap too.
author: David B.

description:
First of all the food is over priced ! Service was TERRIBLE. The guy at the register was not friendly at ALL ! !! After he took our order he started preparing food WITHOUT washing his hands. He then started fighting with some of the employees in front of customers. I was there with two other friend, they walked out the restaurant before me. As I was leaving the lady in the kitchen started saying stuff about us in spanish ! 

The owner needs to pay more attention to this place and hire people with great customer service skills (the people working there had no customer service skills) It seemed like their job is just a pay check ! they did not care at all. No one there smiled or said thank you.
author: Lucy R.

description:
Pretty good burger spot.  

Ordered: 
Super Burger - Ordered with a side of blue cheese.  Great overall texture and taste of the meat.  Cheese and bun with the veg were really good together.  I think if they had more of a sauce presence it could have been better.  

Good overall though.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Full Disclaimer: We ordered to go and didnt eat it till we got to the Oakland Airport, so it wasnt 100% fresh. 

Now, with that said, I dont think being fresh would have helped the sad state of chicken breast on my sandwich. It was thin and pretty flavorless. 

The burger she ordered was pretty decent, but again, nothing that you cant get at pretty much any diner. 

The garlic fries were pretty legit, no worries about vampires with these bad boys!
author: Joseph F.

description:
Firstly, this was the most overpriced burger I've ever had for the (lack of) quality. If I was at a park having a BBQ, this would be OK; instead I paid too much for something that was slapped up in about two minutes. Sure it was quick, I'll give them that. 

I cannot remember a place in the city where I've spent $6.95 for a Coors Light - love the way they conveniently didn't have the beer prices listed.
author: David W.

description:
I love this place. 

Whenever I come here (usually with my boyfriend), we are always served delicious food in a timely manner. Their garlic fries are especially noteworthy.
author: Bella S.

description: Stopped by to try out some place new and found out these burgers are great! The service was on point and their fries were equally as good. Will definitely be returning soon.
author: Michael F.

description:
First off, if I have food poisoning, you heard it here first. I ordered a burger and while I waited, of course, watched the staff making my food.  The woman flipping the burgers took out raw meat with her both her bare hands and placed it on the cooking surface, then she used those same hands and grabbed the buns and started slicing them.  At this point I should have asked for my money back, but I'm not bold enough to say "give me my money back you just gave my burger salmonella".
 
I got my burger and took it back to work.  When I bit into the burger it was completely raw in the middle, and I'm not talking medium rare, I'm talking RAW.  So, I microwaved it.  Finally, I could start eating my burger with the crappy crumbling bun  Half way through my burger I notice that the burger is still raw in some parts even though I had already zapped in the microwave!  Gawd, how much raw meat did I eat?! I tossed the burger in the garbage. I also remembered that the one other time I came to this place my burger was under cooked as well.  I must have blocked out that memory.  There's good seating here and it's in a central place, but the hygiene practices here are just too much of a risk to take.
author: Theresa C.

description:
I've been inactive on Yelp for a year, but I had to sign in again to write a review for this awful establishment!!

First of all, for the prices they charge, service and standards should excel, and the food should taste good, right? But service is poor and so is the food. They seem to have three people working the kitchen and the counter at one time. One for making the crepes/desserts, one for the freshly mixed drinks, and the cook who makes the burgers and fries. Because it's a small space with an open kitchen, you can see EVERYTHING they do behind the counter. The service is poor and slow because they're talking to each other while not doing anything, because one person is asking another person to interrupt their task and complete their order for them, or they are just poorly trained.

I ordered the cheapest options on the menu, a junior burger, fries, and a fountain drink. This small meal still came out to over $9.00.

I could tell right away that my order was going to take long to make. A woman before me gave me a disgruntled look and I could tell she had been waiting for a long time already for her order. As I patiently waited, I watched the staff behind the counter and it made me wish I couldn't see behind the scenes.

While waiting, I noticed how talkative the staff was. I have no problem with this, actually, I think it adds to the charm of a place. But when you're talking and just standing around when you can be cleaning something up, refilling something, or helping the next customer (and there were these things to be done), it pisses me off. At one point, all three of the staff left their areas completely unattended while they were preparing the food! This one man was ordering the girl making drinks to finish up his order, when she was clearly busy finishing orders of her own while taking the orders for the next customers. The cook would constantly pause, chat with her friends who were there, or walk away from view.

The thing that bothered me most was the lack of CLEANLINESS. I was right in front of the poorly trained girl making drinks with raw fruit. She had one glove on while grabbing the chopped up fruit, but she also used the same hand to touch EVERYTHING else! The counter, the fridge door, utensils, machines, and at one point, even the POS register! She never took her glove off, and she continued touching the raw fruits and placing them into the blender! Someone needs to re-train this girl on food safety and kitchen hygiene. The cook would also walk away for a few minutes, touching God knows what and then touching the food.

The food wasn't that great when I finally got it. The fries, which I was most looking forward to, were soggy with oil. The burger was okay, just needed some ketchup because it was a little dry. The meal was definitely not worth almost $10. With a plethora of other expensive food options in the area, skip this place and find something better.
author: Enari L.

description:
I was staying across the street and I was in the mood to find a Japanese Yakatori Izakaya house.  After spending too much time tracking one down, I found the place only took cash.  The closest place to get cash was from an ATM not far from the Burger House.  

I'd passed by the Burger House a few times already in previous days, but I didn't want to have a burger - not when you are in San Francisco, the foodie city.  Alas, I was starving and ready to pass out.  So what the heck I said...what can possibly go wrong?

I figured it couldn't be that bad.  So, I ordered my food and sat down on a stool next to the service area to wait for my food to arrive.  Except they have an open kitchen where I watched the cook and cashier (help out the cook).  These guys touched everything and then I saw the cashier go back to the cash; touching dirty money.

It didn't look like they did anything out of the ordinary preparing my order, but I could see right then that cleanliness habits are not their strong suit.

The food itself wasn't bad...not as gourmet as I've seen elsewhere, but it was good.  One star off for poor cleanliness habits.

In the end, nothing special, good when in a tight spot, but needs to watch the possible food contamination.
author: Kevin Y.

description: Too expensive for low-quality food and ambivalent service. Very little in-house seating.
author: Jackie E.

description:
We were feeling particularly lazy last night and decided to go somewhere close for food. 

We're staying at the Handlery on Geary and Powell which has The Daily Grill attached to it downstairs, but it was getting late so we thought we'd venture out - just not too far.

This is on Powell so it's literally around the corner. I'd read some reviews on here that weren't particularly favourable, but sometimes you just need to check out these places for yourself - especially when they are conveniently close and everything else closes so early.

We ordered two Jr burgers because it was late and I knew the portions would be too big if we'd had anything else. These were just the right size. We also wanted garlic fries, but they'd run out which was a little disappointing, but again, it was pretty late so that's fair!

The server was efficient in taking our order and we sat at the bar and watched the guy make our food. Yes, he didn't wear gloves, but I did see hand washing and the wiping down of surfaces after each preparation. 

The burger came in a wholemeal roll, which was tasty if a little surprising. The salad was super fresh and the burger was tasty and of a reasonable size - I was able to pick the burger up and take a bite because it wasn't competing to be as big as my face. It was also an absolute refreshing change to not have to suffer choice paralysis when ordering; burger or burger.

It came quickly, was cheap, tasty, and convenient. I'm sure there are better places around,  but for convenience and efficiency for us this was absolutely perfect.
author: Hannah B.

description:
A small little place that has small little tables. Came here because of a Groupon. I bought their lunch special which said $6 for a $12 meal. When I arrived and wanted the Cable Car, they said it wasn't available. I was only allowed the $9.25 burgers, which wasn't 50% off as said. So I got the Philadelphia instead and they didn't bother asking us how we wanted ours but asked others so got and overcooked burger. They didn't even ask what we wanted to drink. 

The place isn't that big so finding a place to sit was troublesome. When the food arrived, they were stingy on the fries. The food was pretty good, just a few problems as mentioned. 

I would certainly come here instead of going to Lori's Dinner again.
author: M C.

description:
I was downtown for a doctor's appointment, and I got hungry so I checked my smart phone and look to see what deals they had on Groupon "Now Deals", I was anticipated for some Naan N Curry but they did not have it that day for some reason so I purchased the deal "$6 for a gourmet burger and fries a value of $12".  Sounds like a good deal, better than some fast food restaurant for the same price.

The restaurant lay out is a bit weird, like one big building with three different restaurants connected.  One side was for breakfast and the middle was burger and the other was for pizzas.  Very weird setup but seems like everyone knows each other there.  Most of the people who eat here are tourists.

After looking at the menu I couldn't decide what burger to get and the only drawback to this is you can't order the expensive burger that's more than $12 so I ordered the "Black Angus Beef, Monterey Cheese, tomato and Lettuce".  It also comes with French fries.  No drink, so I just drank water, even though a soda would went down smooth with it and hit the spot.  I was on a budget and yes this will do.

The burger was done perfect; you get this char taste to it like how I like it and pink in the middle.  The buns were sesame seed buns were nicely warm and toasted.  The French fries were very good as well, crispy on the outside and soft in the middle.  Very good texture and well seasoned.

Overall, I wouldn't come to this place again because it's a bit pricey for my wallet.  If they have Groupon deal like this, I wouldn't mind coming back to eat another burger or two.  The staff is friendly and it can be busy or slow depending on the time you go.

*parking*

Parking is going to be difficult, since its downtown.  Parking structures are the best since it's cheaper than getting a ticket.

Cash and credit
author: Kenneth Y.

description: This is really a bad the review for no one mentioning the bad service here. Paid almost $10 for a burger with cheese. They forgot the cheese. I asked them to fix it, mind blown.. It was such an obstacle that in desperation I was given 3 quarters back?? I'm no Gordon Ramsay but I know the logistics of planting cheese on meat. But hey, at least I have 3 quarters to remember how useless change can be in San Francisco.
author: Charles A.

description:
I've been to Burger House now for the fourth time and every time I come there the service gets worse. Not only is it small and cramped inside,  I noticed the cooks DO NOT wear gloves and the woman at the cashier was moving at an outrageous pace for the amount of people waiting in line. 
Yeah. 
I won't be coming back.
author: Patricia C.

description: It's okay everything fresh but meat didn't have enough flavor for my taste. And what I mean by flavor is I don't feel like they marinated the meat... I feel like all they did was put salt and pepper while cooking it. I like my meat to have flavor I like when I go to a burger place and they put different spices in meat and at least let it sit for 1 or a day.
author: Sara R.

description:
Wanted to grab a good, but casual lunch in SF while visiting Union Square. This place is so good. It is a small burger joint with character. The cheeseburger and fries are a good choice and you can sit and watch the chef make the food. 

Would definitely recommend for a quick bite to eat or if you're looking for a casual place to grab lunch.
author: Sarah K.

description: The service is horrible and the hamburgers  are not all that great. You're better off going to jack in the box just down the street.
author: Hector S.

description:
Dry burger? Awkward moment. 

Apple juice? Fresh pressed? Please bish. Talking in general about it, but you judge my friend for it. Not okay.

Our burgers were just sitting there and you never gave us a number, nor called us when it was ready. Not to mention, the reluctance to serve vegetarian options. Disrespectful, at the very least. 

Much better during lunch, but next to disgusting at late night. 

Please don't be open to serving that foul level of food at this time. I would rather not ingest such terrible burgers and go starve, than to pay for such nonsense and have to deal with the repercussions of engulfing such trash the following morning.  

Your ass is on blast. Figure it out and fix your life.
author: Tisha G.

description: Great burger with add-on bleu cheese, egg, onion rings, sides. Super fresh tomatoes! Small place but most excellent burgers.
author: Michael E.

description: We came in for a "quick bite" but were left so full after the Jr. Burger and sweet potatoe fries ! The Jr burger is so juicy and wrapped in the yummiest bun. $11 for a burger, sweet potato fries and a drink - not bad for SF, Union Square. My friend got the hot dog, nice snap and very tasty !
author: Isabel S.

description:
Three napkin turkey burger - yum!

First, I have to tell you about a customer ordering while I was waiting for my food.  He asked the person at the register "is the turkey burger turkey on a burger?"  You have to get out more often.  Must be from the mid-west where it ain't meat unless it is red and moos.

This is a classic SF hole in the wall. At most it has seating for 12.  But they made a mean turkey burger.  It comes served with thousand island spread on it.  But you can add all the mayo, catsup, mustard, pickles and jalapenos that you want.  By the time I was done, I created a real mess, but it was soooooo good.  Best burger I have had in a long time.  

Give this place a try!
author: John F.

description: Quick tasty burger when your on the run in the city.  And you can grab a beer (automatic one star) too.
author: T R.

description:
I should probably start by mentioning that I SERIOUSLY considered one star but finally decided to give them the benefit of the doubt.

I have always been doubtful about this place but the other day as I walked down Powell St. a guy was handing out coupons for a burger, fries and soft drink deal, priced around seven bucks. That is certainly a great deal so I figured it was a perfect opportunity to check the place out.

The experience was basically disappointing all the way around. First of all the vibe is quite chaotic (probably not surprising considering the location). Very limited seating in the restaurant but we were able to find a spot next door in the Pizza place, which seems to be under the same ownership. The coupon I received showed a very tasting-looking burger with lots of cheese hanging out all over the place but in reality they charge you extra if you want cheese. Boo. Our order took a long time for a casual burger joint. When it was finally ready the guy seemed to have forgotten that the coupon included a soft drink as well so I had to ask for that. Soft drink machine was out of ice.

Regarding the food itself, very "meh". Decent burger, kinda small. Fries not so good, extremely dry and a very small portion. Walked away hungry.

As a 7 dollar "bargain" deal it was passable but I would have been PISSED had I payed full price for what I got as it would not have been cheap.

I would recommend walking a few blocks to Pearl's at 6th and Market, similar price but MUCH superior quality.
author: Mike J.

description: Good food, it was fun to get a burger for dinner then share a dessert crepe back at our hotel. It was very yummy. Not easy to find quick, tasty and affordable food in Union square so this place was a great find! Their service was 5star, an error was made on our order but they corrected and the manager who helped us was super nice and put the egg on the side for my infant...he made our day...thank you!
author: Slt S.

description: Great late night spot. Garlic fries ..tons of real garlic. Super burger...half pound burger.yum
author: Ashley A.

description:
Recap: okay in a pinch (for what you're expecting, that is).  Avoid fries (how do you mess up fries? that's a no-no) and seems like their servers avoid you. 

I had their spinach crepe and some fries after a rehearsal.  Was starving, this was the first place I saw and went in.  While, I checked their Yelp and thought they'd be ok.  They barely met those expectations.  

Crepe was pretty ok, but crazy greazy (yes, with a z). The fries were disgusting, in my opinion.  so much salt and over seasoned!

Would've given them 3 stars since this is all I've had there and there could be better, but their servers were really stand-offish.  

Probably not going back.
author: Carlos M.

description: Stumbled upon this place by mistake.  I noticed the small line & they feature "grass fed beef" burgers.  $6.50 for a small burger.  Turned out larger than I thought.  Service was quick, friendly & professional.  Pickles offered on the side without charge.  Delicious!
author: Kehau S.

description: Good size burger, lacked in flavor for me. My bun was extra crunchy, every time I took a bite I had crumbs all over me. My daughter ordered the sliders, all bun little meat. The fries are good however as well as the strawberry shake. Was just ok for me.
author: Ces C.

description: I work in the area so I eat here a lot since I love burgers. They've never messed one up and most of the time they'll make my burgers pretty quick for me which makes a HUGE difference bc lunch is just 30m. They give me a discount (15% I think) because I work in the area! It's annoying that they charge an extra dollar for cheese but that's pretty standard in SF. I would go to Super Duper if I had the time, but with only a half hour for a meal this is good & closer walking distance.
author: Chessie C.

description: Went here late at night around 2:30AM. Got a protein style burger and chicken burger. Both were really good. Great option for late at night and pretty quality. I was a bit skeptical given it's location in union square, but it turned out to be a nice spot. I'll be back.
author: Ahmed H.

description:
Hawaiian Airlines has only 1 flight a day to SF. This means that by the time we get to our hotel it's about 10:00pm.  This is one of the only places nearby open for a super late meal.

It's actually pretty good.  My husband says the burgers are not bad, I always order pizza -and the crust is yummy.

Not a place to go if you have lots of other choices but not a bad meal if its nearby and food is limited.
author: Joanne N.

description: It was late, we were drunk, it was delish!  But seriously, being very buzzed aside...it was a great burger!  Would come back again!
author: Danny V.

description: This place is horrible. Only reason its still in business is because of the tourism. It has to be. The service was the worst I've seen. They cook the food in front of you , but the whole time we were there one of the male cooks was bickering and arguing the entire time. They did not seem to wash their hands when they went from register to grill. The soda tasted like a 1 day open can of coke, no carbonation whatsoever. The bun on the burger was still cold and falling apart. The lazy owner needs to fix this place.
author: Luis V.

description: Flipped a coin with a lady friend in the middle of the night while choosing a midnight snack, and ended up here. Didn't expect the menu to have awesome fresh juice and green smoothies to go with the burgers and crepes. Ended up being a pretty damn good late night snack, and the smoothie with a green tea base was perfect.
author: Justin H.

description: The burgers were amazing!! This was the first food joint we went to and boy was it good! This is our first time in America and I couldn't wait to try the food here! I have to say this is a great start to our American experience! Try the super burger!
author: Lisa L.

description:
One of the best burgers downtown.  I checked out this place because my work had a bunch of their coupons.  Burger House used to be that Chinese fast-food place next to the pizza restaurant.  The only thing weird about this place is that they had a table in the back that sold pizza by the slice.  I can understand if the pizza and burger places were owned by the same people, but it's out of place to have a cash only pizza table in the back of a burger joint.  

I ordered the popular Cable Car Burger which had avocado and bacon all in an egg bun.  Man, was it a tall burger.  I could barely fit it into my mouth (That's what she said..har har).  Every ingredient agreed with each other and the patty was nice and juicy.  Almost everyone at work asked me where I got the burger.  Next time, I'll try their garlic fries.  I heard they're awesome.  Props to the super nice lady who took my order.  :)
author: Lisa X.

description:
PROS:
- Beats In-N-Out if not only because the meat was thick and hearty, the bun fresh, airy and lightly toasted, loaded with sesame seeds. This is a REAL burger.
- They have avocado, another win!
- Nice selection of milkshake options: Dark chocolate (what I got- decadent), your basic neopolitan scoops and oreo.


CONS:
- So greasy! You definitely need multiple napkins. 
-  You could get a similar burger at a diner, this was barely better, but still pretty darn good.
author: Stephanie T.

description: This place was a great stop at 2 AM! Super fresh and tasty food. Friendly staff. Loved the fresh squeezed juice options!
author: Elaine M.

description: The chicken burger and sweet potato fries here are pretty good. One of the best place to eat at night.
author: Pratik J.

description:
Great Food. Love Love the Fresh Juices. 

Drink Smart My favorite! 
Kale 
Apple
Ginger 
Celery
author: LJ E.

description:
Since i work down town, i wanted to check out the new lunch spot.. My lunch buddie ordered her burger, then I placed my order of a cheese burger and chili cheese fries.  We sat down at the bar in the front and just hung out and chatted as we were waiting for our lunch. Waiting.. Waiting.. I look at my recipt to see how long we have been waiting there, 25 min!!! WTF?! Where's our food?!

Basicly they took 30 min to bring out a small(tiny) plate of chili cheese fries($4.75). We both were waiting for our burger..($7-$8 )
I got mine first even though my pregnate friend ordered before me, she didn't get her burger untill she was getting a refund because her lunch time was over! Very un organized!
They were nice enough to comp her the burger, but she didnt even have time to eat it because she had to go back to work!

Can't say we were happy walking out of this new spot, and I can't recommend this place for a quick bite.. If you have the time to sit there, go for it. I rather go to Foleys Irish House Pub for a great burger plus they serve beer too.
author: Lily S.

description: Worst burger I have ever tasted. Look great and delicious. But it's under seasoned bland. The pizza place next door wasn't that great either. The service was really rude.
author: Belinda G.

description:
I loved the Pineapple pizza, and the slices are of great size!
But the room is sooooo small! You can't sit at a table without being hit by someone queuing to order his food!
I don't like missing my mouth when eating because someone hits me.
Then i have tomato sauce on my cheek.
And i don't like that, even if it makes everybody laugh
author: Oleg K.

description:
I don't understand why this place didn't get higher overall star rating! It's really yummy fresh and the people who work here are friendly even though it's in the middle of the more touristys spots in sf!

The burger was super delicious. Fresh thick meat, fresh bread, super hot onion rings and fries! The chicken burger was delicious too. And it fills you up for not just the time being but probably the rest of the night which is unusual for me since I eat constantly !

Must check it out!!

And I get it I'm considered a tourist but just because I'm a tourist doesn't mean I dont know what's good food! Maybe I jar came in on a good night where everything was fantastic. Lol.

Btw, its not as expensive as people are making this place out to be. Hah(:
author: April W.

description: Bad health practices that's why I was forced to give one star :( hope nobody gets sick
author: Zach S.

description: Ordered 3 burgers and fries through Doordash this evening.  Arrived quickly but the burgers were greasy which made the buns soggy. All 3 had the wrong toppings and all of the toppings were sliced so thin that they had wilted in all of the grease. Fries were ok but cold.  We picked at the burgers but most of it got thrown away. A waste of $68.
author: Carrie S.

description:
Maybe I should have read the yelp reviews before eating here. I probably would have kept walking had I done my research. Overpricing....yes indeed!  

It was early, I was starving, I hadn't had eaten a thing, and I was tired of walking. So when I saw their menu outside and saw a good array of breakfast items (my favorite meal of the day), my walking stopped here.  

I ordered the special that came with eggs, potatoes, sausages, and fresh fruit. Sounds like a lot of food, huh? Psshaw, I was very disappointed with how small the portions were. They were stingy on the potatoes; they served me tiny weenie sausages and a dinky cup of fruit.
I LOVED their food, it was delicious. But I just wished they served more of it. With their prices so high, you should expect more.
author: Christine P.

description:
This place serves up a decent burger. The employees are nice and it's cool that you can see them make your burger in front of you.

I don't really have high expectations when a burger place doesn't ask me how I want my burger cooked. I later overheard that they cook all their burgers medium. Ok, I'll give them points because my burger was a good medium. 

The patty was seasoned well, had a good sear, and the special sauce (I'm guessing which is just some sort of thousand island) was good. Structurally, the bun held well and didn't get soggy at all but that's because it was dry, thick and not toasted enough. They just run it through a toaster conveyer rather than on the grill. I was confused by the measly pickle spear that made it's way into the burger. Spears should be served on the side because otherwise you get bites with mostly no pickle and the occasional bite with pickle. But it was so tiny anyway that it didn't really add anything. There was also an overwhelming amount of red onion on the burger. I think I've come to realize that I generally don't like red onions on my burger. 

The fries were well seasoned and nice and crispy.

Overall, a decent burger, but I expect more from a pricier place.
author: Tim W.

description: It was alright. Burger was good, reminded me of in-n-out burger but a little more greasy. However service was absolutely terrible
author: Landon B.

description:
I've said it once and I'll say it again....

I love juicy meat in my mouth!!!

They share a psuedo-wall with a pizza place so you're slightly confused when you walk in. The aromas of fatty fat-fat meaty goodness mixed with tomato sauce and pizza dough. Random but whatever...

This place is overpriced but it's in the middle of Union Square. What do you expect?!? Also, quit your complaining b/c you probably just walked in with bags from DSW, Anthropologie and Saks. 

Fill your face with hot, meaty goodness...who doesn't enjoy that?! Seriously though....you know you like it. Just don't forget to wipe away the dribble on your chin. Some of them are messier than others.
author: Jay H.

description: Entré por casualidad en este sitio el día que llegué a SF y la verdad que no me arrepentí para nada, una de las mejores hamburguesas que he probado en mi vida y a un precio asequible. Lo recomiendo.
author: Alejandro H.

description: "Best gourmet burger"? Prolly not. Satisfying burger when you're hungry? Prolly SO! Loved the Union Square people-watching view sitting outside!
author: Benjamin S.

description:
It's funny how I can live here my whole life and still get duped into overpriced tourist traps. 

Don't get me wrong. The burgers are good - Niman Ranch, generously portioned, well seasoned on fresh sesame seed buns. But at $10 a pop (some cost even more), I felt a bit jipped. Especially since I still have to buy a drink separately. 

However, I do think their steak-cut fries are some of the best I've had. They're not greasy at all. No salt, either - but they don't need any. They're perfect just the way they are.

4 stars for the burgers, 2 stars for value.
author: Mariela D.

description:
Stopped here for dinner after shopping union square, as we were famished and needed something quick. We both had a regular burger (1 patty), mine with blue cheese for an extra $1, and totally worth it. We also shared the garlic fries, which were so delicious, the perfect crispiness, and just enough garlic. The burger was juicy and oh so good, probably one of the best I've ever had! 

Only minus 1 star because it is a tiny restaurant and we had to wait for someone to finish so we could sit together.
author: Laura W.

description:
Burger House got a visit from the San Francisco Burger Blog:

http://sanfranciscoburgerblog.tumblr.com

The awesome: 1/2 lb. burgers are their standard. High-five, fellow fatties! Hold on, let me catch my breath.

Their fries are also really great - nice and thick-cut, not fried into disgustingness but still crispy.

The not-so-awesome: I really wanted to like their onion rings, but the thin slices of onion and their batter end up causing them to get cold within minutes of getting out of the fryer. But you can't go wrong with a burger and fries combo for about $13 in Union Square. 

More info at the link above.
author: Drew H.

description: How good is the super burger and garlic fries yummy
author: Petrea B.

description:
Just what I needed after a night out!
Everyone tells me that SF is known for garlic fries. So far, this place has good garlic fries. Only because I haven't had any other garlic fries to compare it with. 

Aaaand because I was out drinking, I don't remember what I ordered but I do remember waking up wishing I had it again.

I will probably be back in SF soon and definitely will be back here for a late night meal. :)
author: Tiffany K.

description: Came here for dinner on a Friday night. Ordered the bunless burger and sweet potato fries. The burger was very good as were the fries. We sat out on the patio and watched all the interesting people walk by. Made for an interesting evening!
author: Tara T.

description: The burgers here are delicious and worth the expensive price if you're willing to sit around rude staff. Upon asking for water, one of the staff members was extremely rude and was upset that water was asked for. The space is limited and the prices were high. However, the french fries were fried to perfection and the burgers were juicy and huge. Definitely, worth trying but would recommend you take it to go.
author: Amalia M.

description:
The burger was OK at best. The garlic fries were nothing special. Just chopped raw garlic and parsley tossed with oil and doused on fries. The togo brown bag was instantly clear because the oil stains. 

The service was poor. All in all, it would be better to head over to in-n-out and pay less for something tastier.

The only positive note is its close location to Union Square. But don't eat here if you don't have to.
author: I C.

description: OK burgers. Yummy turkey burger. Properly made fries (house made, not frozen, and fried twice, as The Lord intended). The crepe with the chicken and pesto on it looked so good going by, we almost changed our order. This place is a Powell St. tourist trap so ambiance is nil.  But I think I'll try it again the next time I'm in town.
author: J.D. W.

description: I ordered the cable car burger, bf ordered philadelphia burger with chili cheese fries. Both burgers were good and juicy.  But we were sitting right in front of the cooking station, we saw both of the staff there were touching raw patty and touching fresh buns and vegetables without washing hands, that was kinda....gross. But we were like, eh, we won't die from this so we still ate our food. Worst part is the chili cheese fries, it's sour. Come on, Who make their chili sour?! I don't know if it's just us with bad luck or they always make sour chili...
author: Bingjie F.

description: Food is good - service leaves a LOT to be desired. Guy with dark hair and glasses not overly friendly and does not believe in service. Ignores customers - not pleasant.
author: Sean G.

description: Pretty tasty vegetarian burger and a decent price.  I sat at the counter, so unfortunately I had a clear view of the floor in the kitchen area, replete with dropped french fries, discarded lettuce and fallen napkins.  That part was not so great.  It was a Saturday night and they were clearly very busy, but kitchen cleanliness is paramount.
author: Charles Y.

description: Fries had to much garlic , small cute place . I was hoping it was taste just how it looks but honestly didn't like it at .
author: Roxann A.

description:
This past weekend, I happened to be in the City for a birthday celebration.  After a great night out, dancing and laughing, we decided to go and eat.  For some reason, hot dogs were on the mind and so we decided to try and find a place that was serving hot dogs.  To our dismay, we couldn't find any of the cart stands that were all over the streets earlier that day.  Perhaps because it was about 2am in the morning.  

As we were walking up this street, we came across this pizza place that was opened.  A few people in our group went to order some pizza, but while I was waiting, I noticed the place next door served none other than HOT DOGS!

We ended up ordering three plain hot dogs and one of their specialties, the 49er hot dog.  When we finally got to back to our hotel, we could hardly wait to bite into these dogs.  They were excellent and the fries were overwhelmingly good!!!!

Would I come here again, most definitely!!!!  :)
author: Keleka C.

description: Burgers are good, fries suck.
author: Michael E.

description:
Smack in the middle of the Cable Car entranced Touristy Shopping district of Westfield shopping center. There are few eating options around, mostly retail, there is subway, burger king, starbucks (which is on every corner anyways- I literally saw two across the street from on another...not even 100 ft.)
The place had outside seating but no one was sitting there. Inside is tiny, there is a pizza counter small connected which sells by the slice also. I ordered the Super Burger with cheese, my vegetarian wife opted for the Sonoma veggie burger ( its NOT a veggie patty but a bunch of veggies like mushrooms, bellpeppers, eggplant and some other items inside a bun; she loved it. I noticed the bread did get soggy though. One large drink because there are free refills. The order came to almost $20. Kinda Pricey but hey its a tourist trap. The burgers were of quality beef and sesame buns which did not disappoint. If your dining in, they give you a Number so they can bring it to your table. The wait was a little overbearing it wasnt even busy and it still took 15-20 mins. Keep in mind the high chair tabletops area for two people about the size of a large pizza, you cant even put your elbows on them they were soo small.

PROS: Tasty, next to Bart station Powell, shopping nearby, provide jalepenos, mustard, ketchup, mayonaisse, on side in small containers for you to put in. You can see them cook your burger, takes credit cards, menu easy to read on numerous flat screen tvs, free refills, outdoor seating but cramped. They had hot dogs too.

CONS: Little pricey, napkins are the size of pocket tissues, eating area real cramped so its hard to find a table in peak times, wait is long if your in  hurry to do other things. Tables were dirty with salt and pepper, various debris still on them. Lastly there was a garbage  for you to deposit your remaining tray garbage but NO rack for a customer to put them on.

I will go there again if craving, try something else....
author: Ambar G.

description: No good, they offered a $3.50 deal of pepperoni pizza and soda. However, when you order, they required a pamphlet to show the promotion, even though it did no specify on the pamphlet. Terrible place; don't come here for the janky lukewarm pizza either. Go Blondies instead! Just 2 blocks down.
author: Chloe Y.

description: Very delicious burger, I had a super burger it is just perfectly cooked juicy burger also I had a garlic fries yum !!! Not so expensive and friendly staff ...
author: Matt C.

description: Best garlic fries ever! Also our burger was very good. We stopped in one the way to a show at the Warfield and split an order of the garlic fries and  a burger and it was very filling. The garlic fries had fresh chopped garlic on it and I don't think I can say enough how great they were. The staff was friendly and we got our food quickly.
author: Stephanie H.

description: The meat is very tasty and the burger bread is so soft and good that it makes the burger taste much better and put of the ordinary. Definitely a must try
author: Heidy J.

description: This is a great place to have greasy delicious burger with freshly squeezed fruit and veggie juice. Absolutely love this place. Must come back
author: Miranda Q.

description:
My "at least once a week" lunch spot: Burger House. Great quality burger that does the job. Why else does anyone crave for a burger?? To get stuffed to the brim with a nice tasty 100% quality beef patty. They take care in making your burger, so dont even put them in the category of your typical fast food diner type of joint. Friendly service, great food, great location. 

Double Cheeseburger for me, washed down with a cold barq's root beer. food coma after. thats exactly how i like it. 

Cable Car burger is good also. Bacon on that one.
author: Raymon B.

description: Took them 16 minutes to make me a hot dog! And it taste awful!! The place was almost empty and service is very slow.
author: C E.

description: First off, their virgin fries ROCK!!! SO good! Their Jr Burger, because I didn't feel like eating double batty burger and for $4.75 is one TASTY burger! A quick, tasty burger & fries for like $6/$7 AND you taste good? I'm IN!
author: Rob L.

description:
one of the best late night burgers in San Francisco!

I would give this place 5 stars but the cook hates me because I come in near closing time and they close at 2:30am instead of the 3am promoted time.

I order the cable car burger. Which is a burger with swiss chesse, avacado, red onions and bacon. It is definitely above average and everyone I take here says the same thing. Its a bit pricey, but it's in union square so that is expected.

I have yet to try it during the day but If you are out late in SF and you are craving a burger, I definitely recommend this place.
author: Romeo R.

description:
I'm kind of embarassed that most of the reviews on the first page of my profile are of burger places. I used to be a vegetarian, I don't know what happened. No, I do know. Burgers happened. 

Anywho, Burger house is the newest eatery (I think) on Powell, and there were a stack of coupons in the breakroom at work, so I decided to check them out. The first time I ate there, I had the portobello burger (I try), and while it was enormous, it wasn't my favorite. I had all but decided to pass on this place (yes, based on that one experience) when my co-worker suggested we eat there last night.

We started our meal with the avocado/bacon burger, cut in half, which was dee-licious. We split a second course of onion rings, and these were not the kind of onion rings with that thick batter that doesn't ahere to the onion. No, these were dredged in flour right in front of us, and came out with a thin, crispy crust that actually stuck! The third and final course was another burger. We got the classic burger with the condiments that usually come on the salmon buger. Also fantastic. 

So, instead of passing on this place, I decided I love it. Oh, our server, Katelyn, was super nice, too.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
no parking here.  really, not in front.  you'll have to park in the union square garage and walk.  or work nearby.  or walking past.

nice little burger bar.  i was walking by and they had a lady giving out a coupon for a burger for 6.95, small drink, and french fries.  i'm with my parents so we all ordered the same thing...3 of this special.

the counter is as long as the restaurant is and you can see the chef/cook doing all his work as you sit there...unless you're sitting at the end at the back.  he does an excellent job.  works fast and gets it done like you ask.

the young man at the counter who takes the order is very nice and friendly.  not too talkative but just enough to be amusing if you do speak with him more than your order.  he knows the regulars.

the french fries are fresh cut potatoes with a little of the skin on them.  sometimes slightly salty.
author: Bing D.

description: The food here was absolutely fantastic!! Some of the best burgers and fries I have ever had! I ordered the jr burger, which was plenty for one person. The flavor was amazing. The garlic fries is a dish sent from above, they are so delicious I wanted to cry. The freshly chopped garlic made it. The only downside I would say is that they didn't have a lot of seating so it would not be the ideal place for a large group, but we were able to grab a place at the counter pretty quick. Overall, best burgers ever, I can't wait to go there again.
author: Maggie K.

description: Ate here first thing after a long flight from tampa. Burger was good- loved the sesame bun. Fries were good as well- i liked the seasoning, but they were a little potatoey. Great prices. Only complaints were long wait and not much seating room.
author: Richard L.

description:
Came here tonight for dinner with a friend .I had the Classic and my friend ordered the Cable Car Burger. Came with fries, and I got a drink, Total for mine was $12. Pretty good. Burger was good. I loved it. Fries were fresh from the frier that was cooked right in front of us! Decent burgers here. Way cheaper than Burger Bar haha. 

I wished they gave more fries though. They gave so little fries

-1 star for giving too little fries! (They were good, but too little!)
