author: Daniel S.

description: Bought meatloaf for one of the bums outside the place.  It looked and smelled good, and he seemed to enjoy it.  The beers were ok; it looks like your typical cafeteria-esque diner with booze.
author: Marianna K.

description: Great last night find in SF. We are staying in Union Square and had walked past a few times and had a burger elsewhere but never again. Very fresh & well cooked pattie & salads perfect. My wife had the 'bun-less' burger and it was spot on. Nothing dripping with fat & onion rings crunchy & cooked just right. Definitely going back next time we're here.
author: Shaun P.

description:
Nice new place that rocks the whole "all natural niman ranch burger". And at $7.50 for a 1/2 lb burger its a far better deal than other places that promote their all natural niman ranch burgers (I'm talking to you burgermeister).

Plus you can sit outside on the sidewalk and watch all the tourists walk by.

Plus Plus, the staff says they're open late until 2 or 3am which would be awesome for the area.

They're new and just getting started but I see promise.
author: Matt C.

description:
As a local, I usually attempt to avoid the quick eats in the Union Square area. However, when looking for something to eat late you have to appreciate the quick options in the area even if they are gear towards the tourists! 

I desperately needed some food but just wanted something basic. So I ordered the Classic Cheeseburger ($8.25) and upgrade to cheese fries ($1.25). The burger was good, flavorful but not too greasy. The cheese fries left much to be desired. While the fries were good, they were covered in what can only be described as the world's weakest nacho cheese sauce. I was expecting real cheese or at least a nacho cheese sauce with some cheese flavor, this version tasted more buttery than cheesy. 

The dark chocolate milkshake was good. However, I thought the portion was very small for the price ($5.95). 

Overall I was happy considering it was late night food. Not my favorite burger joint but worth going back in for the burger and plain fries!  But I would agree with previous reviewers, for the prices I expect more flavor and real cheese.
author: Marissa P.

description:
Stopped by in the morning around 10AM.  Ordered the classic.  
Pretty standard burger,  came with some avocado and some fries.  Lot's of meat on the burger.  Although I must say that the french fry to burger ratio was not good.  Quite a big burger, but there was like 10 fries.  I would gladly take less burger and more fries to balance it out.  My buddy had the omelet, which was also really good (I know because I took a bite, or 5).  The only thing is that my burger came out in 5 minutes while her omelet took about 30.  The place is a little cramped,  but hey it's the location so i understand.  Overall I liked Burgerhouse.  I'd definitely go back in the future.
author: Vinh L.

description:
Walked into this place at 12am even though Union Square was closed (9pm). The place is somewhat new so, they are a little bit slow, but the burger was fantastic. It can become expensive (9.25 Cable Car burger), but it is much better than McDonald's.
The place is in a central location, and in a heavily trafficked establishment. It is attached to a pizza shop of the same ownership. I have never tried the pizza, but it is popular though. 
The counter is a long row of granite, and you are able to see them cook the burger, hot dogs, etc. The menu is projected on two LCD screens, and is a visual plus in my book with great photos that actually look like the actual food. In saying that the menu is kinda weird on the one hand you have fast food type items, and then crepes on the other side of the menu.
Overall if your in the neighborhood this is a sold place to try.
author: Nathan M.

description: Don't care much for writing reviews, but management needs to know about the horrible customer service. Today is Dec 5 and ordered around 1:30pm. From the apathetic asian girl cashier to the 'I hate my job mamacita', both could learn a thing or two hospitality. When someone says thank you, the incorrect response is, "What?!?!" As for the taste of the burger, will never go here again.
author: K E.

description:
Stay away!  This place is filled with unethical, crazy people.  I had one of my worst lunch experiences of my life in this place.  The people who own this place can not be trusted.  I can say about the food because we never got any.  We finally just ran.

Beware! Do not go in there for any reason.  The people who work there are crazy loons maybe dangerous.
author: terri j.

description: It's not Pearl's, but it'll more than suffice for your burger cravings.  The burgers are huge and I'm a fan of their breakfast burger combo meal (comes with an egg with 2 slices of bacon on top).  It's all good quality Niman Ranch beef too so that um, makes it healthy, right?  Erm, well, anyway...I love their onion rings too, it's too bad I can't get them in lieu of fries (which themselves are fairly decent - kinda like In-N-Out fries on steroids).  Prices are a bit steep and I would suggest checking your order carefully if you get something to go, lest you walk out with a regular cheeseburger when you in fact ordered the breakfast burger. :P  However, it is Union Square and all things considered, it's one of the better deals in the immediate area. 3.5 stars.
author: Sus... B.

description: Needed some after hour party food in Union Square? Go here and won't disappoint.
author: charles s.

description:
Expecting a Union Square trap of mediocre food and high prices, I was pleasantly surprised by Burger House. One of the only places (and to be honest I can't think of another) where their veggie burger is not some off the shelf frozen variety, but various veggies (eggplant, zucchini, etc.) staked between the buns. Subbing a side salad instead of fries was much appreciated. The guy helping me was really friendly throughout.

Fourth star held back as the veggies were greasier than I would have liked, and you are paying an extra buck or two for the location. But it's better than you'd think.
author: Jason B.

description: Had a burger with egg, blue cheese and bacon. The egg was a little overcooked, but the burger itself was hot, juicy and perfectly done. Great overall.
author: Craig D.

description: That is one good ass burger and those have got to be the best fries I've ever had.
author: Ally M.

description: This, friends, is a good burger. As a local who has the unfortunate fortune of working in Union Square, I am surrounded by overpriced tourist spots and bad food. So it's tough to find a truly good spot, but after following my nose and burger craving into Burger House one day, I really did find somewhere worth my money in Union Square. Burgers start at $6, which, for the size, is a great deal. It's massive and packed with fresh toppings (no wilted lettuce here). For an extra $1.50 I always add cheese and grilled onions, yum. The secret sauce is basically Thousand Island meets Ranch. The bun is unique and fresh and the meat is juicy. The fries are good (nothing exceptional) and the garlic fries are maybe too garlicy and greasy but tasty. You won't regret stopping in here!
author: Dallas K.

description: The Fat Fries were good. The burger was done alright but I wasn't a fan of the bun (I always hate it when I get a nice juicy burger but it ends up making the bun soggy (wish they had covered the bottom w/ cheese or something since my bun fell apart pretty quickly :( Service was pretty solid, prices not bad.
author: linda t.

description: The burger, 2.5/5 stars. The garlic fries, 4/5 stars. The value, 2/5. Overall it was all just okay. Meh. But to pay almost $12 for it all was lame. I'm not going back.
author: Paul O.

description: The most memorable burger was the vegetarian burger called the Sonoma Veggie Burger. I'm a meat-eater but this burger was really good!
author: A R.

description:
It was better than I thought it would be. It reminded me of Bistro Burger in the Westfield food court. The burger patty was very delicious. I have never had their type of burger bun before, and it held together pretty well. I also liked their special sauce.

I also had their garlic fries. They used big clumps of garlic, which ok, but wasn't evenly distributed. It was still good, though, but not ballpark-quality.

The service was friendly, and somewhat fast, but only because I was maybe one of 3 sit-down customers.

One downside is that it was very pricey. Angus Burger, garlic fries, & drink came out to be $16. 

They also had limited seating (shared dining area in the back, small counter bar, and shared tables in the front), but I didn't go during the lunch rush, so it wasn't an issue for me, but I can see that it can become an issue.
author: Eric B.

description:
I have a feeling that Burger House will be my favorite burger spot in San Francisco. After debating if I wanted to wait a long time at Burger Bar or find someplace new to eat in the area.. I decided to go with my second choice. As I was walking down the street, I discovered BURGER HOUSE!!!! 

I ordered the Buffalo burger and steak fries.I actually enjoyed my burger. I had to request that they add crumbled blue cheese. The service was great as well. I enjoyed every last bit of my meal. Was tempted to get a chicken salad to go but I didn't want carry the salad while I was still shopping. 

The next day, I came back to the city to return something at Macy's and I decided to go back to BURGER HOUSE again and to my surprise... My burger was great as the first time. I would like to recommend this spot to everyone. I am a burger lover and I know a good burger when I taste one. Staff is super friendly. I just wish that they offer ground lamb burgers.
author: Brooklyn S.

description: Decent Burger, nothing special tho about that. It's the garlic fries that kills it! I am a big garlic fan and I order garlic fries wherever and whenever I get the chance. Too many times tho they are just seasoned fries...garlic powder and a bit of parsley. Not these fries! Burger House makes killer garlic fries! Fresh, greasy, and full of fresh crushed garlic. Your date will hate you, but who cares! If you like garlic, don't pass this joint!
author: Vlad R.

description: The place is tiny but I had the crepes and burgers and they were delicious! Loved their garlic fries!if you are in the area must try! :)
author: Pilar R.

description:
I pass by this place everytime I head to work near the square. This place opened up just a few months ago and used to be a Chinese takeout place which from what I heard from my coworker, expensive and horrible. I was reluctant to go here thinking it would be the same quality as that place before it and the pizza place right next to it. 

But one day I was really craving a burger and decided to give this place a try: 1/2 pound of Niman Ranch beef and a combo deal for $9.25, cheaper than the burger alone at Wolfgangs inside Macys... It couldn't be bad, right?

Actually, the burger was actually pretty good.  It wasn't dry, actually had taste to it and was pretty filling. The fries were just okay though. And the wait was about 15 minutes with one guy in front of me. 

This place is good enough for me to come back and see if their other burgers are just as good....
author: Jonathan A.

description: Good burger in a unique atmosphere. Cheapest meal in SF at on $10.
author: Richard B.

description: Yum! We stopped in on a whim for my daughter to get a burger because she didn't want pizza like the rest of the family. The burger was great! I was kind of sad I didn't order one. It did take a bit for the food to be ready but not extraordinarily long.
author: Kelsi N.

description: I had their Buffalo burger which was pretty good . Their meat is pretty flavorful and moist .... not dry and tasteless like the burgers at other places . Their hamburger bun is pretty good too . I ordered garlic fries but I think they forgot or messed up my order or something because my order ended up coming with regular Virgin fries which tasted decent but not that great . I personally thought their fries were a little too big and made my throat more dry compared to fries from other fast food joints . Would definitely be back though ... I love how they're open until very late .
author: Eileen L.

description: It's surprising that a decent burger place would suddenly pop up in Union Square but it did.  The burgers are big and tasty but a bit on the expensive side.  Either way, if you want a burger, crepe or a quick breakfast and you don't want to wander far from union square this is your place.
author: Theron L.

description:
I was walking down to Market for Union Square, and I notice the burger place... if i'm hungry, and pass by some burger place I've never tried, I'm stopping...
Sadly, it was very subpar...everything was bland, the bun was nasty, oversized, and dried up the whole burger...will never eat here again.... you could go to almost any greasy spoon diner or restaurant and get a better burger for much cheaper...hell, I'd rather go to the Jack in the Box around the corner, or the Burger King a few blocks down, than back to this place... and the fact that on top of the overpriced burgers they charge for grilled onions? Unforgivable
Definitely never going back
author: Joe K.

description: I try to avoid eating in tourist areas, but I stopped in Burger House anyway.  I'm glad I did.  As most reviews mention, the setup is quite different, but don't let that discourage you.  The staff was friendly and the food was very good and reasonable.  I was surprised that my meal (bacon cheeseburger, fries and drink) was only $11.  The burger was cooked well and covered the bun.  The fries were perfect - crispy but tender (I know sounds weird).  My only regret is I didn't get a shake, but there's always a next time.  I was pleasantly surprised by Burger House and will not hesitate to return.
author: Donna W.

description:
This is one of my more unusual reviews. A vegetarian giving- Burger House a good review. I have my reasons:
*- Worked in that area all day, tired and my feet were killing me. I was starving and really needed to eat before my drive back to Marin. 
*-i wanted something quick but good, needed seating and a decent atmosphere where I was okay wearing jeans and tee shirt type of attire.   Actually didn't care about atmosphere if I could get the first two requirements. 
*- They were slammed but still the chef/cook told me to sit since they didn't have anyone at the order counter . He called someone over to take my request while I sat at the counter. So nice people and nice service.
*- Met three wonderful customers so we had a nice chat. It was a relaxed and very friendly environment.
*- In the midst of cooking up burgers and serving pizza next door they were offering crepes.  I had a vegetarian  crepe and it was just what I needed, very tasty, large, and came with a very nice salad.

It's hard to find a quick casual place that doesn't take an hour to sit, order and eat. This place was a find and I will go back.
author: Stella N.

description:
mean foods!!! yummy!! been there like 4 times in a week since arrived sfo for the first time last week.
to the burger house staff - thank you guys for the yummy burger!!!
author: Pandio S.

description: The best Nutella crepe ever!!!  Nutella, bananas, strawberries with a scoop of strawberry ice cream on the side. A little pricey, $13. Sinfully delicious. The place was small and service wasn't very attentive, but the crepe made up for it.
author: Lisa S.

description: Yummy! I havent been in the building since it was the Chinese food place (which was a college fave) so I came in for lunch and ordered the turkey burger. Normally turkey is on the dry side but when I took the first bite.... GIRL!! It was like the Thanksgiving. So good. It had a lot of flavor and I love the fact that they have steak fries.
author: April S.

description: To be fair, the burgers here pretty good. Knocked off a star  due to the fact that it took about 15-20 minutes for a to-go order. Ordering/paying system was a bit inefficient since they only have one register. For a $10 burger and fries...it was decent, but I've definitely had better. Do not order their milkshakes! My coworker paid $6 for one and it was TINY!
author: Vivian D.

description:
okay, so first, i guess i should qualify this by saying i have some ideas about what a burger should be: whether high quality niman ranch on a brioche bun, or greasy late night burger run from a dive, i think burgers should feel a little bit like sin.
if i'm gonna consume this many calories in one sitting, i want to feel a little dirty, but like i just cant help myself. i want to feel compelled to eat everything on my plate even though i dont need to. i want to have to make a difficult choice between the last 3 fries or the last bite of burger. i want to lick my fingers. i want to make a mess. and at the end, much like after hot sex, or a bar fight, i want to feel like i've bested a worthy adversary. 

i stopped into burger house famished, and ready to lay the place to waste like. i got a turkey burger (yanno, for variety), and asked for cheese & bacon. $12. Hrm. okay, well, this place looks pretty nice, hopefully it'll be good.
Oh, fries dont come with it!? Make that $14 bucks. Well, the fries look hearty, alright, I'll bite.

I sat at the counter. I watched them mess up, misplace, or otherwise mangle the 4 orders before mine (literally, mad confusion behind the counter, people getting their orders separated because none of the sides "come with" the sandwiches, everyone had to go back up and ask for missing things, they couldn't find people at their tables, etc.)

i got my burger from the guy at the grill - no bacon. "excuse me, i ordered bacon on this". he looked at me like i was nuts, but tossed a couple of slices on the grill.  (oh vegetarians - they cook meat + veggie burgers on the same griddle.) 
i sat and waited, he placed them on my burger. I lathered it up in condiments, got my lettuce/tomato ratio rockin, and took a bite...

bland.
bun too thick/bready. 
for all the salty meat on this thing, there's not a lot of flavor...hrm.
second bite...
yup. bland. let's try a fry?

eh. bland. the whole thing tastes a little flat.
if i have to douse every bite in condiment, then why am i paying $15 bucks for my lunch? i shoulda just sucked ketchup packets for $0.15 on my walk home.

i ate half the burger and less then half the fries, as soon as the edge was off my hunger i was ready to walk away - a burger not even worth fighting for!?! fogettaboutit.

take your $15 over to oola and get a niman ranch burger on a brioche bun with avocado, applewood bacon, blue cheese, and watercress. the fries come with it - and you could even get a coke. or head to the cheiftain for a chiftain burger - it's like a breakfast sandwich and a burger in one, and their fries are perfect. 

i promise both are a way more sinful and delicious burger experience.
author: cera b.

description:
SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE. NEVER GOING BACK AGAIN.

Ordered a burger with fries and a drink. Waited freakin 20 mins and they brought out the WRONG ORDER. They kept telling me I had ordered a chili cheese dog combo when my f***in receipt says BURGER. Are you f***in stupid or something? How are you gonna go against my words? On top of that, they told me that my order got mixed up and that I was charged less than what I had paid. WTF??? I was told that the burger combo cost a certain price and I paid the amount but now you're telling me I can't get what I paid for? BULLS***!  After another 10 mins of waiting, my order finally came and THEY FORGOT THE F***ING CHEESE! Wow F*** YOU!
author: Kelvin S.

description: I was next door waiting for a pizza to be made so I came over here to order some garlic fry's to go and I could watch them cuz the kitchen was right there. He had nothing to do and it took him 10 min to start to fry the fry's! Let's just say that was the longest wait for crappy garlic fry's.
author: Ryan D.

description: Kinda spendy for a burger joint... $13 for bacon cheese burger, fries, and drink... But it was a decent burger. Fries... not the best... Service was friendly as well...
author: Minh V.

description:
F this place. I should have kept walking down to Blondies - my original intent. I ordered a slice of pizza, and when the lady dropped my change in my hand  two of the coins fell down in the crack amongst the pizzas - she scoweld at me, picked it up, and slammed it down on the glass counter. How RUDE!!  Then, I realized I wanted a drink but hadn't ordered the combo (of course they didn't just pro-rate it and give me the combo price).  But I had the exact change and low and behold when I went to put it on the counter the coins started to roll. I tried to save them but in the process, there was admittedly, a slamming effect. She said I had a bad attitude and muttered obscenities passive-aggresively under her breath. SERIOUSLY?? I was pissed. I had been in a great mood up until that point and this lady, who doesn't even know me, managed to ruin my night. She continued to glare at me as I choked down that piece of cardboard - honestly.
In summary, go to Blondies if you want pizza, please.
author: M-Britt L.

description: Not many options for quick meal in the immediate vicinity of Union Square, unless you want to go to Burger King or a bar.  Burger House was just fine, though I was skeptical because it's connected to the by-the-slice pizza place next door.  They adverstised Niman Ranch beef, so I was hopeful I wouldn't be getting a frozen patty.  In the end, it was just fine.  Good burger on a good bun.  Friendly service.  Clearly, place caters to the bar crowd later at night and they do breakfast items all day.  Was it the best burger I've ever had?  No.  Was it better than Burger King for a quick late evening bite?  Hell, yeah.  The garlic fries weren't half bad either - a lot of garlic.
author: Ryan W.

description: Absolutely the grosses burger I have ever had. NO flavor, bad service. Just avoid this place like the plague.
author: Colleen H.

description: Okay - we're going one more star. They are very conveniently located on Powell and a good stand-in when I can't justify the wait or the price at Burger Bar. Don't get me wrong, this is no Burger Bar, but an okay spot to grab a quick bite.
author: Robert M.

description: Plenty of fries.  Plenty of meat.  Service is meh and place is small, but come on, it's a burger joint.  Very satisfied :). Oh, and could use a TV, not just for the menu lol.
author: Eugene W.

description: The burger is awesome.  Spicy with outstanding beef.  Milkshakes are pricey, but the burgers are the real star.
author: A L.

description: Nice addtion to Powell St. Great burgers at an even better price. Friendly staff and a nice selection on their menu. You can sit outside and pig out too. Definitely something to check out...
author: Michael P.

description: I saw a menu in the break room at work, and I decided to give it a try from the usual places that I frequent daily. I ordered the Cable Car burger, and it was amazzzzzzzzzing! the beef was delish, and the fries, yuuuuuummmmm, I love french fries, but these are steak fries, that are perfectly salted...I will most def b going back!
author: Jay K.

description: Great quality burgers, reasonable prices and the best part right on the heart of Union Square. What else can you ask for ... My first time ordering a burger from Burgerhouse( to go) and let me tell you... it was delicious for less than $10.00 dollars you get a 1/2 pound of hand-formed Niman Ranch 100% angus beef, I order mine medium well and it was cooked to perfection. It came with thick and very tasty french fries but the other best part was the Bun "OMG" additionally lettuce, tomato, onion and pickle and they must have a secrete homemade sauce because it was very, very tasty. The place is simple you go to the counter and order (just like that ) but the flavors are huge and very exquisite. Try it !!
author: Ernesto C.

description:
much better than i expected
had the cable car (??) the one with bacon and avocado - loved it!!
the staff was very nice
i like having a good burger place in such a convenient location. 
it's about $10 for a burger and fries, but it's closer than in-n-out and great quality beef. they have various specials so it is possible to eat for less than $10.
it's small and cramped so seating can be tough
author: Deka M.

description: The location is perfect, since it is located within walking distance of Union Square, but the food isn't out of this world. I ordered the Buffalo wings with a side of "fancy fries" and it was okay. The place itself is pretty small and they share the space with a pizza shop, which happens to be operated or managed by the most annoying lady. She voluntarily moved a chair that was next to me with mine and a friend's purse without even asking me or giving me a heads up. Seating was a bit of an issue since we were limited to two tables outside, or a few cramped ones inside. The food itself was filling, the wings weren't great, the taste was a bit dull and overpowered by the dressing they offered as a side. The fries were just like any other you'd find at any random restaurant. I'm not giving the place three stars because on my visit here I was rudely interrupted by the manager of the pizza restaurant that we had to share seating with; she had moved the chair I had placed next to me with mine and a friends purse without telling me and once I scooted it back closer to me, she rudely asked me not to do it because I would block the condiments that were easily accessible without my things in the way.
author: Diana L.

description: I went here after purchasing a "Groupon Now" and was pleasantly surprised. I had the buffalo burger with fries and the food came out yummy and hot! The servers were also nice and very pleasant. Good place to go if you're in the area and want a quick bite!
author: Kay R.

description: I  love their burgers but my favorite one  is 49er Hot Dog.It's so yummy and fresh.They also have delicious crepes with strawberry and banana flavours I wish they had kiwi crepe tho :( Also the service is great,Turkish guy is friendly.Only negative thing seems like their fries,it just doesn't really look fresh.
author: Jessica V.

description: Lunch options when you work in Union Square kind of suck. If you want a good burger you can go to the Jack in the Box, This place, or Burger Bar. I choose Burger House. The service and wait time kind of suck so I call in my order. It's a bit on the spendy side, but you're hard pressed to get lunch for under $10 anywhere around here unless you go for fast food. The fries are AWESOME. Definitely worth a shot if you are a local and work in the area-I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here. If you're a tourist and want a good burger, walk a few blocks and treat yourself to The Grand Cafe.
author: Nitalia P.

description: oh em gee!!! amazing burgers!!!
author: Jamie Y.

description: Very Unethical:   I purchased the Groupon "$6 for a Gourmet Burger and Fries at Burger House SF, 50% off " and ordered a chicken burger from the burger section of the menu ~$9.??, and showed them the groupon.  They said with the groupon offer I can only get their basic "classic beef burger" ~$8.??.    This was mention Nowhere in the  groupon offer.   I ended up not eating there, not because of the price difference (only ~1$) but because of their unethical service.
author: Alex S.

description: one of the best burgers ive eaten in a good whiles. try the cable car burger and garlic fries. excellent customer service and is perfect if your craving food late at night, great alternative to your typical denny's after club places
author: Alan C.

description: Burger House is a joke. My girlfriend and I purchased Groupons for this restaurant and looked forward to using them. When we showed up, the cashier rejected our Groupons. Let me clarify: the Groupon printout states it is good for "A Gourmet Burger and Fries." Nowhere on the voucher did it say which type of burger. Furthermore, the value of the voucher is, according to Groupon, 50% off. Seeing as how we purchased the voucher for $5, my math skills tell me that the voucher should be worth $10. Well, the cashier said we can only get the cheapest burger, which is just a patty and bread. We asked if we could speak to her manager, but she replied that she has no idea where the manager is at the time. When she talked to her co-worker, her co-worker came and said if we could wait an hour at the restaurant, the manager MIGHT show up. I asked if the manager could help, but then the original cashier chimed in and said the manager would be taking their side because they're right. Nice job, Burger House. We decided not to use the Groupon at all and just left.
author: Stanley C.
